utterance.speaker: AMBER
utterance.content: Oh Drake.

utterance.speaker: DR. REMORE
utterance.content: I'm sorry Amber. It's just like Brad to have to have the last word.

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: I'm sorry I'm late, what happened?

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: We, we just wanna see the end.

utterance.speaker: AMBER
utterance.content: I want you Drake.

utterance.speaker: DR. REMORE
utterance.content: I know you do but you and I can never be together that way.

utterance.speaker: AMBER
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: DR. REMORE
utterance.content: There's something I never told you Amber. I'm actually your half- brother.

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: So what happens next?

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: Well, I get the medical award for separating the siamese twins. Then Amber and I go to Venezuela to meet our other half-brother, Ramone. And that's where I find the world's biggest emerald. It's really big but it's cursed.

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: God that is good TV.

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: Phoebs, play with meeee.

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: No. This game is grotesque. Twenty armless guys joined at the waist by a steel bar, forced to play soccer forever. Ahh, hello, human-rights violation.

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: Ya know Phoebs, don't feel so bad for 'em. After they're done playing, I break out the little plastic women and everybody has a pretty good time.

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: Why don't you play with your roommate?

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: Ah he's a, he's not a big fan of foosball.

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: Uh oh, ooh, are we not getting along with the new boy?

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: No he's, he's alright, just uh, he spends most of his time in his room.

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: Maybe that's because you haven't taken the time to get to know him. Let's remedy that, shall we?

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: We don't need to remedy that.

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: Oh yeah, it'll be fun.

utterance.speaker: EDDIE
utterance.content: What was that?

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: Hi, um, I just thought that it would be fun if the three of us had some beers and got to know each other.

utterance.speaker: EDDIE
utterance.content: Yeah alright, that sounds alright.

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: Oh good, ok. Oh nooo, I have to go because I'm late for my um, Green Eggs and Ham discussion group. Um tonight it's why he would not eat them on a train. Have fun bye.

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: That was so lame.

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: I know, yeah. Ok, talk to him.

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: So, you uh, you think that Speed Racer guy gets a lot of tickets er?

utterance.speaker: EDDIE
utterance.content: That's good, that's good. So, so, so who broke up with who?

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: What're you kidding? I broke up with her. She actually thought that Sean Penn was the capital of Cambodia.

utterance.speaker: EDDIE
utterance.content: That's good man, when everybody knows that the uh, the capital of Cambodia is uh...

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: Well it's not Sean Penn.

utterance.speaker: EDDIE
utterance.content: Not Sean Penn. Alright, I, I've got a funny one, alright. My last girlfriend Tilly. Ok, we're eating breakfast, right, and I made all these pancakes, there was like 50 pancakes right. And all of the sudden she turns to me, alright, and she says, 'Eddie.' I say, 'yeah,' she says, 'Eddie, I don't want to see you anymore.' And it was literally like she had reached into my chest, ripped out my heart, and smeared it all over my life, ya know. And now there's like this incredible abyss, ya know, and I'm falling and I keep falling and I don't think I'm ever gonna stop. That uh, wasn't such a funny story, was it?

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: And a crusty old man said I'll do what I can and the rest of the rats played moroccas. That's it, thanks, good night.

utterance.speaker: RICHARD
utterance.content: Phoebe's got another job, right?

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: Great set tonight Phoebs.

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: I know.

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: Well, we should probably get going.

utterance.speaker: RICHARD
utterance.content: Um, we should go too, I got patients at 8 in the moring.

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: Ya know, I was thinking. Ya know how we always stay at your apartment? Well, I thought maybe tonight we'd stay at my place.

utterance.speaker: RICHARD
utterance.content: I don't know, I don't have my jammies.

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: Well, maybe you don't need them.

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: My baby sister, ladies and gentlemen.

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: Shut up, I'm happy.

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: Oh, this is so nice. Alright I have to make a speech. I just wanna say that of all the guys that Monica has been with, and that is a lot, I like you the best.

utterance.speaker: RICHARD
utterance.content: Oh, thank you Phoebs. That's very sweet.

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: Ok.

utterance.speaker: RICHARD
utterance.content: Hear that? She likes me best, and apparently there've been a lot.

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: Not a lot, Phoebe's kidding, Phoebe's crazy.

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: Phoebe's dead.

utterance.speaker: TILLY
utterance.content: Hi.

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: Hi.

utterance.speaker: TILLY
utterance.content: I'm looking for Eddie Minowick.

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: Oh, uh, he's not here right now, uh, I'm Chandler, can I take a message, or, or a fishtank?

utterance.speaker: TILLY
utterance.content: Thanks.

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: Oh, oh, c'mon in.

utterance.speaker: TILLY
utterance.content: I'm Tilly.

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: Oh.

utterance.speaker: TILLY
utterance.content: I gather by that oh that he told you about me.

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: Oh yeah, your uh, name came up in a uh, conversation that terrified me to my very soul.

utterance.speaker: TILLY
utterance.content: He's kind of intense huh?

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: Yes. Hey, can I ask you, is Eddie a little...

utterance.speaker: EDDIE
utterance.content: A little what?

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: Bit country? C'mon in here you roomie.

utterance.speaker: EDDIE
utterance.content: Hello Tilly.

utterance.speaker: TILLY
utterance.content: Eddie, I just came by to drop off your tank.

utterance.speaker: EDDIE
utterance.content: That's very thoughtful of you. It's very thougtful.

utterance.speaker: TILLY
utterance.content: Well, ok then. I'm gonna go. Bye.

utterance.speaker: EDDIE
utterance.content: Bye-bye.

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: Bye.

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: So, we gettin' a fish?

utterance.speaker: EDDIE
utterance.content: You had sex with her didn't you?

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: Phoebs, check it out, check it out, check it out, check it out.

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: Oh, ooh, Soap Opera Digest, oh that's one of my favorite digests.

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: Page 42, page 42, page 42.

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: Ok, ok, ok. Ooh, hey 'new doc on the block, Days of Our Lives' Joey Tribbiani.' Ooh, cool picture.

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: Ooh, I look good.

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: Hey is this true, that you write a lot of your own lines?

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: Uh, well, kinda yeah. Like, remember last week when Alex was in the accident? Well the line in the script was, 'If we don't get this woman to a hospital, she's going to die.' But I made it, ' If this woman doesn't get to a hospital, she's not gonna live.'

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: Ohh, ok, I see what you did there. Aren't you afraid though, that the writers are gonna be kinda mad when they read this?

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: Huh? Never really thought about the writers. The scripts just kinda come to my house. But you know what? This makes me look good, which makes the show look good, which makes the writers look good so how could they be mad about that?

utterance.speaker: WRITER
utterance.content: Makes up most of his lines. Son-of-a-. Yeah, well, write this jerkweed.

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: I fall down an elevator shaft? What the hell does this mean, I fall down an elevator shaft?

utterance.speaker: DELIVERY GUY
utterance.content: Uhh, I don't know, I just bring the scripts.

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: They can't kill me, I'm Francesca's long lost son.

utterance.speaker: DELIVERY GUY
utterance.content: Right. Could you sign this?

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: No. No way, I'm not signing that.

utterance.speaker: DELIVERY GUY
utterance.content: I don't think that's gonna affect the plot of the show.

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: How can they do this to me?

utterance.speaker: DELIVERY GUY
utterance.content: Er, uh, I'm just gonna go. Sorry.

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: Well it wasn't that many guys. I mean, if you consider how many guys there actually are, it's a very small percentage.

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: Hey, it's not that big a deal, I was just curious.

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: G'night.

utterance.speaker: RICHARD
utterance.content: Night Richard. Good luck Mon.

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: Alright, before I tell you, uh, why don't you tell me how many women you've been with.

utterance.speaker: RICHARD
utterance.content: Two.

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: Two? TWO? How is that possible? I mean, have you seen you?

utterance.speaker: RICHARD
utterance.content: Well, I mean what can I say? I, I was married to Barbara for 30 years. She was my high school sweetheart, now you, that's two.

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: Two it is. Ok, time for bed, I'm gonna go brush my teeth.

utterance.speaker: RICHARD
utterance.content: Woah, woah, no wait a minute now. C'mon it's your turn. Oh c'mon. Ya know, I don't need the actual number, just a ballpark.

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: Ok, it is definitely less than a ballpark.

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: Wow, I am so glad I'm not Monica right now.

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: Tell me about it. So what, what's your magic number?

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: Uhhhooo.

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: C'mon, you know everyone I've been with. All, both of them.

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: Well, there's you.

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: Better not be doin' these in order.

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: Ok, uh, Billy Dreskin, Pete Carney, Barry, and uh, oh, Paolo.

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: Oh yes, the weenie from Torrini.

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: Oh honey, are you jealous of Paolo? Oh, c'mon, I'm so much happier with you than I ever was with him.

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: Really?

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: Oh please. That Paolo thing was barely a relationship. All it really was was just, ya know, meaningless animal sex. Ok, ya know, that sounded soooo much better in my head.

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: Eddie, I didn't sleep with your ex-girlfriend.

utterance.speaker: EDDIE
utterance.content: That's very interesting, ya know, 'cause that's exactly what someone who slept with her would say.

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: This is nuts. This is crazy. She came over for like two minutes, dropped off a fish tank, and left, end of story.

utterance.speaker: EDDIE
utterance.content: Where's Buddy?

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: Buddy?

utterance.speaker: EDDIE
utterance.content: My fish, Buddy.

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: There was no fish when she dropped it off.

utterance.speaker: EDDIE
utterance.content: Oh, this is, this is unbelievable. I mean, first you sleep with my ex-girlfriend then you insult my inteligenct by lying about it and then you kill my fish, my Buddy?

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: Hey I didn't kill your fish. Look Eddie... Would you look at what I'm doin' here. That can't be smart. So we're just gonna take this guy right off ya and put him here in Mr. Pocket. Tangellon?

utterance.speaker: RICHARD
utterance.content: That's it? That's the giant number you were afraid to tell me?

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: Well yeah.

utterance.speaker: RICHARD
utterance.content: Well, that's not bad at all. I mean, you had me thinkin it was like a fleet.

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: You really ok with it?

utterance.speaker: RICHARD
utterance.content: Oh honey, I'm fine.

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: Oh, yay. Ok about that two.

utterance.speaker: RICHARD
utterance.content: What? Alright, what about my two?

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: Well, it just seems like a really small number.

utterance.speaker: RICHARD
utterance.content: Right, and...

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: And, well, don't you have a lot of wild oats to sew? Or is that what you're doing with me? Oh my God, am I an oat?

utterance.speaker: RICHARD
utterance.content: Honey, you are not an oat. I, I mean I don't know, I, I guess I'm just not an oat guy. I've only slept with women I've been in love with.

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: But you've only slept with two people.

utterance.speaker: RICHARD
utterance.content: Right.

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: Wow. Oh wow. You know I love you too, right.

utterance.speaker: RICHARD
utterance.content: Now I do.

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: Ross, Ross, please listen to me. Ross, you are so much better for me than Paolo ever was. I mean you care about me, you're loving, you make me laugh.

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: Oh, hey, if I make you laugh, here's an idea, why don't you invite Paulo over and have a little romp in the sack and I'll just stand in the corner and tell knock-knock jokes.

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: God, Ross, look, what you and I have is special, all Paolo and I ever had was...

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: Animal sex, animal sex? So what're you saying, I mean, you're saying that like, there's nothing between us animal at all. I mean there's not even like, uhm, a little animal, not even, not even like, like chipmunk sex?

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: Ok, Ross, try to hear me. Ok, I, hey, I'm not gonna lie to you. Ok, it was good with Paolo.

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: Knock-knock.

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: But, what you and I have is so much better. Ok, we have tenderness, we have intimacy, we connect. Ya know, I swear, this is the best I have ever had.

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: Until now.

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: Oh, hi.

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: Hi. Richard just told me he loves me.

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: Oh my God, honey that's great.

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: I know. I just can't find...

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: Oh they're in the top drawer. Hurry.

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: You need one too?

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: Ooooh yeah.

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: There's only one.

utterance.speaker: RICHARD
utterance.content: Monica.

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: Hi. Uh, we'll be right there, we're just trying to decide something.

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: Rachel. Hey.

utterance.speaker: RICHARD
utterance.content: Hey. They're just trying to decide somehting.

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: Good, good, good. So, is uh, was your moustache, did, used to be different?

utterance.speaker: RICHARD
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: Oh. How do you uh, ya know, keep it so neat?

utterance.speaker: RICHARD
utterance.content: I have a little comb.

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: Oh. And what do you call that?

utterance.speaker: RICHARD
utterance.content: A moustache comb.

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: Ok, I, I will do your laundry for one month.

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: Ok, ok, ok, I will, I will, I, hey, I will clean the apartment for two months.

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: Alright, I tell you what, I'll give this to you now if you can tell me where we keep the dustpan.

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: Agghhh.

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: So were you in Nam?

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: Rock-paper-scissors?

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: RACHEL and MONICA
utterance.content: One two three.

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: Yeesss.

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: Fine, go have sex.

utterance.speaker: RICHARD
utterance.content: No. You have got it completely wrong. John Savage was deerhunter, no legs, John Voit was coming home, couldn't feel his legs.

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: No, no way. You've got it totally the other way around my friend. John Voit was...

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: Honey.

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: What, what oh....

utterance.speaker: RICHARD
utterance.content: Shall we?

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: It's not gonna happen. They're doing it tonight, we can do it tomorrow.

utterance.speaker: RICHARD
utterance.content: Uh, in the future, if I could see the schedule beforehand...

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: So, when I woke up this morning, he'd stolen all the insoles out of my shoes.

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: Why?

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: Because he thinks I slept with his ex-girlfriend and killed his fish.

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: Why would you kill his fish?

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: Because sometimes, Phoebe after you sleep with someone, you have to kill the fish.

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: Chandler honey, I'm sorry. Ok, can we watch Joey's show now please?

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: Wait, he's not here yet.

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: So, he's on the show, he knows what happens.

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: Alright.

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: Oh, I'm fine about my problem now, by the way.

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: Oh good.

utterance.speaker: DR. REMORE
utterance.content: Amber, I want you to know that I'll always be there for you, as a friend and as your brother.

utterance.speaker: AMBER
utterance.content: Oh Drake.

utterance.speaker: DR HORTON
utterance.content: Hard day huh? First the medical award, this.

utterance.speaker: DR. REMORE
utterance.content: Some guys are just lucky I guess.

utterance.speaker: INTERCOM
utterance.content: Dr. Remore, report to first floor emergency, stat.

utterance.speaker: DR. REMORE
utterance.content: Well then, uh, I uhh, guess that's me. Anyone else need to go on the elevator? Dr. Horton, Dr. Wong?

utterance.speaker: DR. HORTON
utterance.content: No, no, they only said you.

utterance.speaker: DR. REMORE
utterance.content: Oh, ok. Alright.

utterance.speaker: AMGER
utterance.content: I love you Drake.

utterance.speaker: DR. REMORE
utterance.content: Yeah, whatever. Oh no.

utterance.speaker: AMBER
utterance.content: Drake, look out.

utterance.speaker: DR. REMORE
utterance.content: Ahhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhh.

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: Did they just kill off Joey?

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: No. Now maybe.

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: C'mon.

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: Joey.

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: Open up. We want to talk to you.

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: I don't feel like talkin.

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: Oh c'mon Joey, we care about you.

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: We're worried about you.

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: And some of us really have to pee.

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: Sorry Joey

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: Listen, sorry about your death, that really sucks.

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: We came over as soon as we saw.

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: How could you not tell us?

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: I don't know, I was kinda hopin' no one would ever find out.

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: Well, maybe they can find a way to bring you back.

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: Naa, they said that when they found my body, my brain was so smashed in that the only doctor that could have saved me was me. Supposed to be some kind of irony or somethin.

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: But Joey, you're gonna be fine. You don't need that show, it was just a dumb soap opera.

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: Phoebe, this was the greatest thing that ever happened to me.

utterance.speaker: PHOEBE
utterance.content: Yes, I was going to incorporate that. Oh good, here's Monica, she'll have something nice to say.

utterance.speaker: MONICA
utterance.content: Um, I straightened out your shower curtain so you won't get mildew. What? To me that's nice.

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: It's gonna be ok. You know that?

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: No, I don't. It's like, ya know, you work your whole life for somethin' and you think that when you get it it's never gonna be as good as you thought it would be. But this so was. Ya know, it changed everything. Like the other day, I got this credit card application, and I was pre- approved. Huh? I've never been pre-approved for anything in my life.

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: I'm sorry man.

utterance.speaker: RACHEL
utterance.content: Yeah, Joey honey, I don't know if this'll mean anything to you but you'll always be pre-approved with us.

utterance.speaker: JOEY
utterance.content: No, that means nothin to me.

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: Uhhhaahh.

utterance.speaker: EDDIE
utterance.content: Pecan sandy, just made em.

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: Yeah alright. What're these, raisins?

utterance.speaker: EDDIE
utterance.content: Uh, sure, why not.

utterance.speaker: EDDIE
utterance.content: I got a little surprise, look. There's a new fishie. I named him uh, Chandler, you know, after, after you.

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: Well that's not an, even a real fish. No, that's a goldfish cracker.

utterance.speaker: EDDIE
utterance.content: What's you point man?

utterance.speaker: CHANDLER
utterance.content: Ok, good night. You big freak of nature.

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: RICHARD
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: RICHARD
utterance.content: Ohh, brisk tonight.

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: Oh man.

utterance.speaker: RICHARD
utterance.content: Let's never speak of this.

utterance.speaker: ROSS
utterance.content: You got it.
